Posts.Content: PLilly wrote: I was talking with my neighbor about our upcoming Christmas vacation in the mountains, she mentioned that cross-country skiing should be okay but that I shouldn't do any downhill skiing.  She couldn't remember the details but she thinks that downhill skiing was an activity listed as a lymphedema risk.  Is this true? What precautions should I take while I'm up there? Yvette Dx 5/11/2006, IDC, 2cm, Stage II, Grade 3, 1/10 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Is Downhill Skiing a risk? PLilly Munchy

Posts.Content: Dec 19, 2007 04:52PM PLilly wrote: Hey Debbie, Alice Jean and Binney- Thank you so much for answering my question so quickly.   We are going be skiing locally here in SoCal at Big Bear, which is at an elevation of about 6000 or 7000 feet. The NP from my doctor's office left me a message today saying that it was okay to ski and stated the same thing you said about doing the arm exercises plus to rest and hydrate myself between runs and to bring an Ace bandage with me to wrap my arm with if it shows any sign of swelling. She didn't think I needed to get a sleeve since I haven't been diagnosed with LE or shown any symptoms of it yet.  Alice Jean -  I 'm sorry to hear that you have bone mets.  I'm glad that your treatment is working and hopefully even those little spots here and there will disapear. Binney -  Yikes, I had no idea that the hot tub was a risk- I've been doing that for almost 6 months now. Thanks for the LE website there is a lot of good info there I didn't know about. Thanks again for the info and the stories you made my day! Yvette
